other_tests.findings: Patent iliac vessels, several femoropopliteal stenoses, occlusion of the right superficial femoral artery, and severe distal atherosclerosis.
Thrombosis of the initial part of the right external iliac artery and severe distal arteritis with developed collateral branches.
Normal sinus rhythm preoperatively; intraoperatively showed sinus bradycardia with left bundle-branch block.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No evidence of an acute myocardial ischemic event during VT.

other_tests.findings: Successful on the first attempt; postdural puncture headache and subsequent neurologic symptoms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial headache improved and the patient was discharged without sequelae.

other_tests.findings: Lesion in the left posterior cortex suspicious for ganglioneuroma.
Lesion indicative of ganglioneuroma or encephalomalacia.
